newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks close up in technical rebound.
newsitem.headline: French stocks close up in technical rebound.

text.p: French stocks finished higher in a technical rebound on Wednesday, helped by strong results at blue-chip energy group Total, brokers said.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index closed up 13.34 points, or 0.68 percent, at 1,984.77, while the CAC-40 September futures contract finished 15 points higher at 1,992.
Wednesday's rise was the second in the past eight sessions and traders said the bourse appeared to be under pressure.
They said investors were likely to be cautious ahead of the U.S. August jobs figures due out on Friday.
Traders said the market shrugged off a second set of missile attacks by the United States on Iraq and was encouraged by reports of planned tax cuts in the 1997 budget.

Energy group Total's shares rose 0.13 percent to 385 francs, extending their recent gains, after reporting a 45 percent jump in first-half net attributable profit, reflecting higher production and higher oil prices.
Rival Elf-Aquitaine, due to report first-half results on Thursday morning, also closed up 0.18 percent at 382.50 francs.
